WorkItem.ClosedComment:
I just updated the razor layout (_layout) to take from the MS CDN:

http://www.asp.net/ajaxlibrary/cdn.ashx.

jQuery, jQuery UI and related CSS is now being pulled from the CDN. The project still needs to have those items pruned.
WorkItem.Description:
We should take advantage of CDNs for hosting scripts wherever possible. For example, we don't need to include jQuery here, we could reference it from:

   http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.3.2/jquery.min.js

It'll help our latency etc...
WorkItem.Summary: Use jQuery from a CDN rather than hosting it

Comments.Message: Attaching patch to use Microsoft CDN for jQuery and MS Ajax. Not sure if we want to consider offline dev/demo scenario here.

Adding in jQuery, will add in MS AJAX when MVC 2 scripts are supported. Planning to use this approach: http://weblogs.asp.net/jgalloway/archive/2010/01/21/using-cdn-hosted-jquery-with-a-local-fall-back-copy.aspx
